dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 137 (121b 7x4 4x6 218m) SR: 113.22

dismissalComment.html: chases a wide, fuller ball and edges it to the wicketkeeper. Had to reach out for it and it is a simple catch for Mushfiqur. Walks out to a rich applause from the crowd. Proud moment for the hometown boy

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Colin Munro c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan 87 (61b 8x4 4x6 83m) SR: 142.62

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and makes room before trying to clear the in-field on the off-side. But Shakib did well to take the ball away from the left-hander. It was the slider arm ball and Munro was beaten by pace as well. Skews it to point who runs back and snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: caught in front as he plays all around a skidder! It isn't exactly as short as he thought and the second he went back to it, he was in trouble. Broom had got into a routine flicking the left-arm spinner since there isn't any turn on this pitch. But Shakib has one-upped him by a subtle change in length and his quicker pace. Batsman hits across the line, misses, bowler bowling wicket-to-wicket strikes. Simple

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pinned in front again! Second batsman to stay back to a ball that is too full. That's the reason the umpire was confident putting his finger up even if the ball was tailing into leg. It doesn't have too much distance to travel thereafter. Neesham walks off, having committed two mistakes. Misreading the length, and flicking across the line

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and makes room before trying to clear the in-field on the off-side. But Shakib did well to take the ball away from the left-hander. It was the slider arm ball and Munro was beaten by pace as well. Skews it to point who runs back and snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: first wicket for Mustafizur. It's the slower delivery and Guptill does not pick it up. It was full and on leg and middle channel. Guptill was looking to loft him straight down the ground but his bat face opens awkwardly as he makes contact and he ends up skying it towards mid-off where Soumya Sarkar takes it easily

chases a wide, fuller ball and edges it to the wicketkeeper. Had to reach out for it and it is a simple catch for Mushfiqur. Walks out to a rich applause from the crowd. Proud moment for the hometown boy

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c Soumya Sarkar b Mustafizur Rahman 15 (19b 1x4 1x6 25m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: first wicket for Mustafizur. It's the slower delivery and Guptill does not pick it up. It was full and on leg and middle channel. Guptill was looking to loft him straight down the ground but his bat face opens awkwardly as he makes contact and he ends up skying it towards mid-off where Soumya Sarkar takes it easily

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 31 (36b 5x4 0x6 48m) SR: 86.11

dismissalComment.html: nicks off! Taskin's extra bounce has turned Williamson's strength into a weakness. His eyes lit up at the short ball, the width tempted him as well. But the big, scary fast bowler has done him in by making the ball kick up a little more. Effort ball. Massive wicket

Batsman hits across the line, misses, bowler bowling wicket-to-wicket strikes. Simple

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 137 (121b 7x4 4x6 218m) SR: 113.22

dismissalComment.html: chases a wide, fuller ball and edges it to the wicketkeeper. Had to reach out for it and it is a simple catch for Mushfiqur. Walks out to a rich applause from the crowd. Proud moment for the hometown boy

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi b Taskin Ahmed 5 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: you miss, I hit. Fuller ball on off and middle. Ronchi swipes as he looks to heave it through the leg side. Can't put bat to ball which crashes into the stumps. Missed a straight ball

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Southee b Ferguson 59 (54b 5x4 2x6 75m) SR: 109.25

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many. Ferguson continues with the short ball - this time he gets one to rise up to the chest, the line is on off stump as well. That means the pull is a dangerous shot, the batsman can't get any leverage. The top edge seems academic and Southee completes a simple catch moving to his left at midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mosaddek Hossain not out 50 (44b 5x4 3x6 57m) SR: 113.63

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: held by Williamson moving to his right. It was fuller outside off and Sarkar was looking to heave it over the extra cover region. Opens the face of his bat and does not time it properly. Ends up chipping it in the air and Williamson who is at mid-off takes it
chases a wide one and gets a healthy edge to the keeper. Floats a tempter a set of stumps outside off and Mahmudullah falls for the bait. Double strike for Neesham. Bangladesh need to be careful now

he's upper cut the ball to deep point. Good grief. Stands forlorn as he watches Santner running in from the boundary and sealing the catch with some style. It is short. It is asking to be hit. It becomes a wicket. There's something very scoreboard pressure about this wicket. That, or I'm being kind to a terrible shot

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many. Ferguson continues with the short ball - this time he gets one to rise up to the chest, the line is on off stump as well. That means the pull is a dangerous shot, the batsman can't get any leverage. The top edge seems academic and Southee completes a simple catch moving to his left at midwicket

helps a short ball to third man. Course Boult has to help himself too, diving forward to take a good low catch. Made sure when he came in contact with the ground, it wasn't with the elbow, which tends to pop the ball out. Poor Sabbit. If he were playing bulls-eye with the fielder there, he would be walking away with a prize. Considering he isn't...
big top edge on the pull, snaffled by Ronchi behind the stumps. It was a short ball and he was in no position to play it. Not enough room and finds it hard to deal with the bounce as well

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Ronchi b Southee 16 (21b 2x4 1x6 33m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: and HotSpot confirms that it was an edge. Short ball. Kayes swivels around and pulls but skews it off the edge to the wicketkeeper who dives to his right and takes the catch. Kayes reviews it but it anyway seemed like it had gone off the glove. Replays then show that it has taken a healthy edge and the on-field decision stays

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Williamson b Neesham 1 (8b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 12.5

dismissalComment.html: held by Williamson moving to his right. It was fuller outside off and Sarkar was looking to heave it over the extra cover region. Opens the face of his bat and does not time it properly. Ends up chipping it in the air and Williamson who is at mid-off takes it

dismissalComment.html: chases a wide one and gets a healthy edge to the keeper. Floats a tempter a set of stumps outside off and Mahmudullah falls for the bait. Double strike for Neesham. Bangladesh need to be careful now

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Santner b Neesham 38 (59b 5x4 0x6 90m) SR: 64.4

dismissalComment.html: he's upper cut the ball to deep point. Good grief. Stands forlorn as he watches Santner running in from the boundary and sealing the catch with some style. It is short. It is asking to be hit. It becomes a wicket. There's something very scoreboard pressure about this wicket. That, or I'm being kind to a terrible shot

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many. Ferguson continues with the short ball - this time he gets one to rise up to the chest, the line is on off stump as well. That means the pull is a dangerous shot, the batsman can't get any leverage. The top edge seems academic and Southee completes a simple catch moving to his left at midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Boult b Ferguson 16 (11b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 145.45

dismissalComment.html: helps a short ball to third man. Course Boult has to help himself too, diving forward to take a good low catch. Made sure when he came in contact with the ground, it wasn't with the elbow, which tends to pop the ball out. Poor Sabbit. If he were playing bulls-eye with the fielder there, he would be walking away with a prize. Considering he isn't...

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim retired hurt 42 (48b 3x4 0x6 91m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: slower short of a length ball, picks the drop in pace and waits for it before laying into a pull shot. Picks the gap in the deep midwicket region

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Broom b Santner 14 (10b 3x4 0x6 9m) SR: 140

dismissalComment.html: makes room for himself but Santner follows him and Mortaza is cramped for room. He is not able to free his arms as well as he would have liked and his wild slog only carries till the fielder at deep midwicket. And Mortaza's burst meets a swift end

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed c Ronchi b Ferguson 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: big top edge on the pull, snaffled by Ronchi behind the stumps. It was a short ball and he was in no position to play it. Not enough room and finds it hard to deal with the bounce as well

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman b Southee 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: yorker on off-stump. Mustafizur backed away and tried to play a cover drive away from the body. Does not put bat to ball and the ball crashes into the stumps. And that will be the end of the match as Rahim is not coming out to bat

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman b Southee 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: yorker on off-stump. Mustafizur backed away and tried to play a cover drive away from the body. Does not put bat to ball and the ball crashes into the stumps. And that will be the end of the match as Rahim is not coming out to bat

commentPostTextItems.html: We were unable to get pictures for the presentation, so we won't be able to bring it to you. Thank you for your patience. That's it from us for this match. Until next time!

8pm Bangladesh will come out of this match knowing fully well that they are much better than that. This is not the start to the series they were hoping for. On a belter of a pitch, their batsmen struggled to score quick runs, mainly due to their inability to rotate strike. Fielding lapses did not hit them as hard today, but they have a lot of brushing up to do. No doubt that the side has all the skills. But the question remains if they can execute their plans well and capture the big moments. We will bring the presentation to you shortly.

commentTextItems.html: slower wide ball, cut square of the wicket and that brings up the fifty for Mosaddek

commentPostTextItems.html: We are unable to relay commentary due to technical difficulties. Apologies for the inconvenience.

commentTextItems.html: short of a length, angling in, swats it it over mid-on with a flat bat

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed c Ronchi b Ferguson 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 18.18

commentTextItems.html: big top edge on the pull, snaffled by Ronchi behind the stumps. It was a short ball and he was in no position to play it. Not enough room and finds it hard to deal with the bounce as well

headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: good length on the fifth-stump channel, Taskin shuffles across and blocks into the off side
sees some width on offer and opens the face of his bat to uppishly guide this length ball to third man
backs away and tries to flat-bat this short of a length ball over the off-side field but misses as the ball follows him and cramps him for room
stays a long way away from the ball and whacks it with a half flat bat towards mid-on. No run there
gets across to cover his off-stump and pushes this length ball towards mid-on

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: short ball outside off, tries to ramp it but can't deal with the bounce and misses
short ball, tries to pull but the ball bounces steeply and he gets pinged on the helmet, near the ear
fuller ball, turned away to midwicket
tries to force this short of a length ball through the off side but gets undone by the extra bounce
fires a good length ball in the corridor and draws the batsman forward, Taskin sticks his bat out and gets beaten

commentTextItems.html: short and wide outside off, slapped away

Broom had got into a routine flicking the left-arm spinner since there isn't any turn on this pitch. But Shakib has one-upped him by a subtle change in length and his quicker pace. Batsman hits across the line, misses, bowler bowling wicket-to-wicket strikes. Simple

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pinned in front again! Second batsman to stay back to a ball that is too full. That's the reason the umpire was confident putting his finger up even if the ball was tailing into leg. It doesn't have too much distance to travel thereafter. Neesham walks off, having committed two mistakes. Misreading the length, and flicking across the line

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and makes room before trying to clear the in-field on the off-side. But Shakib did well to take the ball away from the left-hander. It was the slider arm ball and Munro was beaten by pace as well. Skews it to point who runs back and snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill c Soumya Sarkar b Mustafizur Rahman 15 (19b 1x4 1x6 25m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: first wicket for Mustafizur. It's the slower delivery and Guptill does not pick it up. It was full and on leg and middle channel. Guptill was looking to loft him straight down the ground but his bat face opens awkwardly as he makes contact and he ends up skying it towards mid-off where Soumya Sarkar takes it easily

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c Mushfiqur Rahim b Taskin Ahmed 31 (36b 5x4 0x6 48m) SR: 86.11

dismissalComment.html: nicks off! Taskin's extra bounce has turned Williamson's strength into a weakness. His eyes lit up at the short ball, the width tempted him as well. But the big, scary fast bowler has done him in by making the ball kick up a little more. Effort ball. Massive wicket

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Neil Broom lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 22 (32b 0x4 0x6 37m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: caught in front as he plays all around a skidder! It isn't exactly as short as he thought and the second he went back to it, he was in trouble. Broom had got into a routine flicking the left-arm spinner since there isn't any turn on this pitch. But Shakib has one-upped him by a subtle change in length and his quicker pace. Batsman hits across the line, misses, bowler bowling wicket-to-wicket strikes. Simple

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Neesham lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 12 (13b 2x4 0x6 15m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: pinned in front again! Second batsman to stay back to a ball that is too full. That's the reason the umpire was confident putting his finger up even if the ball was tailing into leg. It doesn't have too much distance to travel thereafter. Neesham walks off, having committed two mistakes. Misreading the length, and flicking across the line

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Colin Munro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Colin Munro c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan 87 (61b 8x4 4x6 83m) SR: 142.62

dismissalComment.html: comes down the track and makes room before trying to clear the in-field on the off-side. But Shakib did well to take the ball away from the left-hander. It was the slider arm ball and Munro was beaten by pace as well. Skews it to point who runs back and snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 137 (121b 7x4 4x6 218m) SR: 113.22

dismissalComment.html: chases a wide, fuller ball and edges it to the wicketkeeper. Had to reach out for it and it is a simple catch for Mushfiqur. Walks out to a rich applause from the crowd. Proud moment for the hometown boy

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi b Taskin Ahmed 5 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: you miss, I hit. Fuller ball on off and middle. Ronchi swipes as he looks to heave it through the leg side. Can't put bat to ball which crashes into the stumps. Missed a straight ball

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Santner b Neesham 38 (59b 5x4 0x6 90m) SR: 64.4

dismissalComment.html: he's upper cut the ball to deep point. Good grief. Stands forlorn as he watches Santner running in from the boundary and sealing the catch with some style. It is short. It is asking to be hit. It becomes a wicket. There's something very scoreboard pressure about this wicket. That, or I'm being kind to a terrible shot

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Ronchi b Southee 16 (21b 2x4 1x6 33m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: and HotSpot confirms that it was an edge. Short ball. Kayes swivels around and pulls but skews it off the edge to the wicketkeeper who dives to his right and takes the catch. Kayes reviews it but it anyway seemed like it had gone off the glove. Replays then show that it has taken a healthy edge and the on-field decision stays

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Williamson b Neesham 1 (8b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 12.5

dismissalComment.html: held by Williamson moving to his right. It was fuller outside off and Sarkar was looking to heave it over the extra cover region. Opens the face of his bat and does not time it properly. Ends up chipping it in the air and Williamson who is at mid-off takes it

headshotImage.caption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: James Neesham player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Ronchi b Neesham 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: chases a wide one and gets a healthy edge to the keeper. Floats a tempter a set of stumps outside off and Mahmudullah falls for the bait. Double strike for Neesham. Bangladesh need to be careful now

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Southee b Ferguson 59 (54b 5x4 2x6 75m) SR: 109.25

dismissalComment.html: one shot too many. Ferguson continues with the short ball - this time he gets one to rise up to the chest, the line is on off stump as well. That means the pull is a dangerous shot, the batsman can't get any leverage. The top edge seems academic and Southee completes a simple catch moving to his left at midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim retired hurt 42 (48b 3x4 0x6 91m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: slower short of a length ball, picks the drop in pace and waits for it before laying into a pull shot. Picks the gap in the deep midwicket region

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Boult b Ferguson 16 (11b 0x4 1x6 17m) SR: 145.45

dismissalComment.html: helps a short ball to third man. Course Boult has to help himself too, diving forward to take a good low catch. Made sure when he came in contact with the ground, it wasn't with the elbow, which tends to pop the ball out. Poor Sabbit. If he were playing bulls-eye with the fielder there, he would be walking away with a prize. Considering he isn't...

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mosaddek Hossain not out 50 (44b 5x4 3x6 57m) SR: 113.63

headshotImage.caption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mitchell Santner player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Neil Broom player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Broom b Santner 14 (10b 3x4 0x6 9m) SR: 140

dismissalComment.html: makes room for himself but Santner follows him and Mortaza is cramped for room. He is not able to free his arms as well as he would have liked and his wild slog only carries till the fielder at deep midwicket. And Mortaza's burst meets a swift end

headshotImage.caption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lockie Ferguson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed c Ronchi b Ferguson 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: big top edge on the pull, snaffled by Ronchi behind the stumps. It was a short ball and he was in no position to play it. Not enough room and finds it hard to deal with the bounce as well

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman b Southee 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: yorker on off-stump. Mustafizur backed away and tried to play a cover drive away from the body. Does not put bat to ball and the ball crashes into the stumps. And that will be the end of the match as Rahim is not coming out to bat

notes: New Zealand innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 50 runs, 1 wicket)
New Zealand: 50 runs in 9.5 overs (59 balls), Extras 11
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 188 runs, 3 wickets)
Drinks: New Zealand - 78/1 in 14.0 overs (TWM Latham 20, KS Williamson 31)
New Zealand: 100 runs in 18.3 overs (111 balls), Extras 12
TWM Latham: 50 off 56 balls (2 x 4, 1 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 53 balls (TWM Latham 29, NT Broom 20, Ex 1)
Over 25.5: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - WR Knights, Batsman - JDS Neesham (Struck down)
New Zealand: 150 runs in 27.3 overs (165 balls), Extras 13
Drinks: New Zealand - 181/4 in 32.0 overs (TWM Latham 72, C Munro 16)
New Zealand: 200 runs in 36.1 overs (217 balls), Extras 13
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 52 balls (TWM Latham 27, C Munro 27, Ex 0)
TWM Latham: 100 off 100 balls (5 x 4, 3 x 6)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 103 runs, 3 wickets)
New Zealand: 250 runs in 41.2 overs (248 balls), Extras 13
C Munro: 50 off 44 balls (3 x 4, 3 x 6)
5th Wicket: 100 runs in 80 balls (TWM Latham 47, C Munro 52, Ex 1)
New Zealand: 300 runs in 45.1 overs (271 balls), Extras 14
5th Wicket: 150 runs in 103 balls (TWM Latham 67, C Munro 83, Ex 2)
Innings Break: New Zealand - 341/7 in 50.0 overs (MJ Santner 8, TG Southee 7)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 43 runs, 1 wicket)
Over 7.3: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - WR Knights, Batsman - Imrul Kayes (Struck down)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 191 runs, 5 wickets)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 12.2 overs (74 balls), Extras 9
Drinks: Bangladesh - 64/3 in 15.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 31, Shakib Al Hasan 6)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 22.2 overs (135 balls), Extras 16
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 51 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 37, Mushfiqur Rahim 10, Ex 3)
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 50 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 28.2 overs (171 balls), Extras 18
Drinks: Bangladesh - 159/5 in 30.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 17, Sabbir Rahman 9)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 34.6 overs (211 balls), Extras 22
Mushfiqur Rahim retired hurt at 219/6 (42, 38.3 overs)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 47 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 24, Mosaddek Hossain 23, Ex 5)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 30 runs, 3 wickets)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 41.5 overs (252 balls), Extras 25
Mosaddek Hossain: 50 off 44 balls (5 x 4, 3 x 6)

milestones.description: Shakib has become the top wicket-taker for BAN in ODIs with 218 wickets, going past Mortaza's 215

stories.title: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 2016-17
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: New Zealand v Bangladesh
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 2016-17

stories.title: Mashrafe points finger at 'lethargic' fielding
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza points finger at 'lethargic' fielding
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza described Bangladesh's fielding as 'lethargic' after their 77-run loss to New Zealand

image.caption: Mustafizur Rahman celebrates the wicket of Martin Guptill with team-mates
image.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman celebrates the wicket of Martin Guptill with team-mates, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch, December 26, 2016

stories.title: Kane Williamson: fastest to 4000 for New Zealand
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Stats - Kane Williamson becomes fastest to 4000 for New Zealand
stories.summary: Stats highlights from the first one day international between New Zealand and Bangladesh in Christchurch

image.caption: Fastest to 4000 ODI Runs
image.longCaption: Kane Williamson became the joint fourth fastest to 4000 ODI runs.

stories.title: Latham and Munro topple Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Tom Latham and Colin Munro topple Bangladesh
stories.summary: Tom Latham and Colin Munro set up New Zealand's 77-run win in Christchurch, after their 158-run fifth-wicket stand pulled the hosts out of a difficult position

image.caption: Tom Latham pulls behind square
image.longCaption: Tom Latham pulls behind square, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch, December 26, 2016

stories.title: Bruised New Zealand eye return to winning ways
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Bruised New Zealand eye return to winning ways
stories.summary: New Zealand have made changes to address their recent struggles in ODI cricket, but despite their foothold in familiar conditions, they have their task cut out against a resurgent Bangladesh side

image.caption: Not just bowling partners, Tim Southee and Trent Boult also take catches together
image.longCaption: Not just bowling partners, Tim Southee and Trent Boult also take catches together, England v New Zealand, 2nd ODI, Kia Oval, June 12, 2015

videos.title: Isam: Munro's innings was turning point
videos.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
videos.seoTitle: Isam: Munro's innings was turning point
videos.summary: Colin Munro's 87 off 61 balls injected momentum into New Zealand's innings in the first ODI at Hagley Oval, where the hosts won by 77 runs

galleries.title: Latham delivers Boxing Day knockout
galleries.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch

stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe Mortaza points finger at 'lethargic' fielding

image.longCaption: Kane Williamson became the joint fourth fastest to 4000 ODI runs.

stories.title: Latham and Munro topple Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Tom Latham and Colin Munro topple Bangladesh
stories.summary: Tom Latham and Colin Munro set up New Zealand's 77-run win in Christchurch, after their 158-run fifth-wicket stand pulled the hosts out of a difficult position

image.caption: Tom Latham pulls behind square
image.longCaption: Tom Latham pulls behind square, New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch, December 26, 2016

stories.title: Bruised New Zealand eye return to winning ways
stories.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
stories.seoTitle: Bruised New Zealand eye return to winning ways
stories.summary: New Zealand have made changes to address their recent struggles in ODI cricket, but despite their foothold in familiar conditions, they have their task cut out against a resurgent Bangladesh side

videos.title: Isam: Munro's innings was turning point
videos.subTitle: New Zealand v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Christchurch
videos.seoTitle: Isam: Munro's innings was turning point
videos.summary: Colin Munro's 87 off 61 balls injected momentum into New Zealand's innings in the first ODI at Hagley Oval, where the hosts won by 77 runs
